column4: So I put a new partition into fstab, and i told it to mount at /home ... when i try to log in, it says Cannot enter home directory.  Using /. So I entered failsafe and edited fstab to mount the disk in /mnt but I still get the error, what am i doing wrong.
have you confirmed that the partition is getting mounted ?
ok
cannot move /home to /old_home : device or resource busy, how do i make it unbusy >.>
generally that means the a terminal is 'cd' to somewhere in '/home'
yea, how do i cd out.
or do i just load from live cd
cd to somewhere else like 'cd /'
i booted into live disc, permission denied moving all files in /old/home to /new/ find . -depth -print0 | cpio --null --sparse -pvd /new/
ok,   what does "ls -ld /new' return?
did you sort out your problem?
pretty much, but new problem i am working on resolving myself, since it was nearly working earlier and i broke it and i need to get back to that nearly working state so i can try something i found
good!  I have been having hardware troubles myself.
oops! that sounded bad.
sweet, i got further now.
seemed my mount point did not exist >.>
ok.  don't forget to check the premissions of the mount point once you have done the mount.
yea i just had to change that.
from recovery mode
what troubles are you havin
all sorts of messages when booting, saying ata4.0 is having trouble, and a very slow boot.
oh, sounds hardware related.
yes!  but as this is the second new drive, that its reporting trouble with, and it an old motherboard, and I have been having trouble for the last 6 months,
i would suspect mobo then
